channel.title: Portforward help?
channel.description:
I can't seem to portforward!! Help?
Portforwarding:
[IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/jsmslj.jpg[/img]
Firewall:
[IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/2jf6af.jpg[/img]

item.title: Portforward help?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Oh yeah, did you make sure your local IP didn’t change? Most people don’t set up static IP’s and they can renew at any given moment.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward help?
item.dc:creator: @emptyone999 emptyone999
item.description:
@emptyone999 wrote:

This is very easy to fix, add me on skype: emptyone01

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward help?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Jmood:

You can search it on google, type your service providers name in and then add blocked ports, or ports blocked. They should have a list of ports they block.

Or just call them and ask, that’s always available. Granted you have to get them during their service hours.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward help?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

You can search it on google, type your service providers name in and then add blocked ports, or ports blocked. They should have a list of ports they block.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward help?
item.dc:creator: @bedo911 bedo911
item.description:
@bedo911 wrote:

Jmood:

It may be that your ISP is blocking the port, which means no matter what you do you still cannot run it on that port. Check your ISP to see what ports they block, you may also want to make sure the server is binding to the same port you have forwarded.

Okay I’ll try to check my ISP. Thanks for the feedback hope it helps[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:515902”][quote author=bedo911 link=topic=634156.msg4282507#msg4282507 date=1365893054]

Go to canyouseeme.org and enter the port: “43594” to see if you’re truly portforwarded.

That’s the problem. It can’t see it. Where did I do wrong?
[/quote]
Turn the server on first, then use canyouseeme
And also this:

[quote author=Jmood link=topic=634156.msg4282660#msg4282660 date=1365913271]
It may be that your ISP is blocking the port, which means no matter what you do you still cannot run it on that port. Check your ISP to see what ports they block, you may also want to make sure the server is binding to the same port you have forwarded.
[/quote][/quote]

EDIT = I cant seem to find how to check if it’s blocking it or not. How shall one do this?

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward help?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“bedo911, post:3, topic:515902”][quote author=Free Sosa link=topic=634156.msg4282457#msg4282457 date=1365882992]
Go to canyouseeme.org and enter the port: “43594” to see if you’re truly portforwarded.
[/quote]
That’s the problem. It can’t see it. Where did I do wrong?[/quote]
Turn the server on first, then use canyouseeme
And also this:

Jmood:

It may be that your ISP is blocking the port, which means no matter what you do you still cannot run it on that port. Check your ISP to see what ports they block, you may also want to make sure the server is binding to the same port you have forwarded.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward help?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

It may be that your ISP is blocking the port, which means no matter what you do you still cannot run it on that port. Check your ISP to see what ports they block, you may also want to make sure the server is binding to the same port you have forwarded.

Read full topic

item.description:
@1_2_3_4_KOED wrote:
